IncidentInfo.description: Information about an incident raised on an asset.

customType.description: An optional custom incident type. Present only if type is 'CUSTOM'.

title.description: Optional title associated with the incident

description.description: Optional description associated with the incident

entities.description: A reference to the entity associated with the incident.

priority.description:
A numeric severity or priority for the incident. On the UI we will translate this into something easy to understand.
Currently supported: 0 - CRITICAL, 1 - HIGH, 2 - MED, 3 - LOW
(We probably should have modeled as an enum)

assignees.description: The parties assigned with resolving the incident

status.description: The current status of an incident, i.e. active or inactive.

source.description: The source of an incident, i.e. how it was generated.

startedAt.description: The time at which the incident actually started (may be before the date it was raised).

created.description: The time at which the request was initially created

IncidentAssignee.description:
The incident assignee type.
This is in a record so that we can add additional fields if we need to later (e.g.
the type of the assignee.

actor.description: The user or group assigned to the incident.

assignedAt.description: The time & actor responsible for assiging the assignee.

AuditStamp.description: Data captured on a resource/association/sub-resource level giving insight into when that resource/association/sub-resource moved into a particular lifecycle stage, and who acted to move it into that specific lifecycle stage.

time.description: When did the resource/association/sub-resource move into the specific lifecycle stage represented by this AuditEvent.

actor.description: The entity (e.g. a member URN) which will be credited for moving the resource/association/sub-resource into the specific lifecycle stage. It is also the one used to authorize the change.

impersonator.description: The entity (e.g. a service URN) which performs the change on behalf of the Actor and must be authorized to act as the Actor.

message.description: Additional context around how DataHub was informed of the particular change. For example: was the change created by an automated process, or manually.

IncidentStatus.description: Information about an incident raised on an asset

state.description: The top-level state of the incident, whether it's active or resolved.

stage.description:
The lifecycle stage for the incident - Null means no stage was assigned yet.
In the future, we may add CUSTOM here with a customStage string field for user-defined stages.

message.description: Optional message associated with the incident

lastUpdated.description: The time at which the request was initially created

IncidentSource.description: Information about the source of an incident raised on an asset.

sourceUrn.description: Reference to an URN related to the source of an incident.
